channel.title: CVE Feed for Eclipse Foundation -- ThreadX
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Eclipse Foundation -- ThreadX

item.title: CVE-2024-2212|2024-03-26T15:58:27.486Z -- Eclipse Foundation -- ThreadX
item.description: In Eclipse ThreadX before 6.4.0, xQueueCreate() and xQueueCreateSet() functions from the FreeRTOS compatibility API (utility/rtos_compatibility_layers/FreeRTOS/tx_freertos.c) were missing parameter checks. This could lead to integer wraparound, under-allocations and heap buffer overflows.

item.title: CVE-2024-2452|2024-03-26T15:43:36.233Z -- Eclipse Foundation -- ThreadX
item.description: In Eclipse ThreadX NetX Duo before 6.4.0, if an attacker can control parameters of __portable_aligned_alloc() could cause an integer wrap-around and an allocation smaller than expected. This could cause subsequent heap buffer overflows.

item.title: CVE-2024-2214|2024-03-26T15:48:36.304Z -- Eclipse Foundation -- ThreadX
item.description: In Eclipse ThreadX before version 6.4.0, the _Mtxinit() function in the Xtensa port was missing an array size check causing a memory overwrite. The affected file was ports/xtensa/xcc/src/tx_clib_lock.c
